3960    /**
3961     * Generate a word from this FakeLanguageGen using the specified StatefulRNG with an approximate number of
3962     * syllables, potentially setting the state of rng mid-way through the word to another seed from {@code reseeds}
3963     * more than once if the word is long enough. This overload is less likely to be used very often.
3964     *
3965     * @param rng        the StatefulRNG to use for the randomized string building
3966     * @param capitalize true if the word should start with a capital letter, false otherwise
3967     * @param approxSyllables the approximate number of syllables to produce in the word; there may be more syllables
3968     * @param reseeds an array or varargs of additional long seeds to seed {@code rng} with mid-generation 
3969     * @return a word in the fake language as a String
3970     */
3971    public String word(IStatefulRNG rng, boolean capitalize, int approxSyllables, long... reseeds) {
3972        if (approxSyllables <= 0) {
3973            sb.setLength(0);
3974            sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingVowels));
3975            for (int m = 0; m < modifiers.size(); m++) {
3976                modifiers.get(m).modify(rng, sb);
3977            }
3978            if (capitalize) sb.setCharAt(0, Character.toUpperCase(sb.charAt(0)));
3979            return sb.toString();
3980        }
3981        int numSeeds, fraction = 1;
3982        if (reseeds != null)
3983            numSeeds = Math.min(reseeds.length, approxSyllables - 1);
3984        else numSeeds = 0;
3985        while (true) {
3986            sb.setLength(0);
3987            ender.setLength(0);
3988            int i = 0;
3989            if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelStartFrequency) {
3990                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingVowels));
3991                if (approxSyllables == 1)
3992                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(closingConsonants));
3993                else
3994                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midConsonants));
3995                i++;
3996            } else {
3997                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(openingConsonants));
3998            }
3999            String close = "";
4000            boolean redouble = false;
4001            if (i < approxSyllables) {
4002                if (numSeeds > 0 && i > 0 && i == approxSyllables * fraction / (1 + numSeeds))
4003                    rng.setState(reseeds[fraction++ - 1]);
4004                if (rng.nextDouble() < syllableEndFrequency) {
4005                    close = rng.getRandomElement(closingSyllables);
4006                    if (close.contains("@") && (approxSyllables & 1) == 0) {
4007                        redouble = true;
4008                        approxSyllables = approxSyllables >> 1;
4009                    }
4010                    if (!close.contains("@"))
4011                        ender.append(close);
4012                    else if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelEndFrequency) {
4013                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4014                        if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
4015                            ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
4016                                    .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4017                        }
4018                    }
4019                } else {
4020                    ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4021                    if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
4022                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
4023                                .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4024                    }
4025                    if (rng.nextDouble() >= vowelEndFrequency) {
4026                        ender.append(rng.getRandomElement(closingConsonants));
4027                        if (rng.nextDouble() < syllableEndFrequency) {
4028                            close = rng.getRandomElement(closingSyllables);
4029                            if (close.contains("@") && (approxSyllables & 1) == 0) {
4030                                redouble = true;
4031                                approxSyllables = approxSyllables >> 1;
4032
4033                                //sb.append(close.replaceAll("@\\d", sb.toString()));
4034                            }
4035                            if (!close.contains("@"))
4036                                ender.append(close);
4037                        }
4038                    }
4039                }
4040                i += vowelClusters.matcher(ender).findAll().count();
4041            }
4042
4043            for (; i < approxSyllables; i++) {
4044                if (numSeeds > 0 && i > 0 && i == approxSyllables * fraction / (1 + numSeeds))
4045                    rng.setState(reseeds[fraction++ - 1]);
4046                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4047                if (rng.nextDouble() < vowelSplitFrequency) {
4048                    sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(vowelSplitters))
4049                            .append(rng.getRandomElement(midVowels));
4050                }
4051                sb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midConsonants));
4052            }
4053
4054            sb.append(ender);
4055            if (redouble && i <= approxSyllables + 1) {
4056                sb.append(close.replaceAll("@", sb.toString()));
4057            }
4058
4059            if (sanityChecks != null && !checkAll(sb, sanityChecks))
4060                continue;
4061
4062            for (int m = 0; m < modifiers.size(); m++) {
4063                modifiers.get(m).modify(rng, sb);
4064            }
4065
4066            if (capitalize)
4067                sb.setCharAt(0, Character.toUpperCase(sb.charAt(0)));
4068
4069            if (clean && !checkAll(sb, vulgarChecks))
4070                continue;
4071            return sb.toString();
4072        }
4073    }

4131     *                                the very end of a sentence
4132     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4133     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4134     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4135     */
4136    public String sentence(int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4137                           double midPunctuationFrequency) {

4163    /**
4164     * Generate a sentence from this FakeLanguageGen using the specific RNG. The sentence's length in
4165     * words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from
4166     * {@code midPunctuation} between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency}
4167     * (between 0 and 1), and will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
4168     *
4169     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
4170     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
4171     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
4172     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
4173     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
4174     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4175     *                                the very end of a sentence
4176     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4177     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4178     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4179     */
4180    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4181                           double midPunctuationFrequency) {
4182        if (minWords < 1)
4183            minWords = 1;
4184        if (minWords > maxWords)
4185            maxWords = minWords;
4186        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4187            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4188        }
4189        ssb.setLength(0);
4190        ssb.ensureCapacity(12 * maxWords);
4191        ssb.append(word(rng, true));
4192        for (int i = 1; i < minWords; i++) {
4193            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
4194                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4195            }
4196            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
4197        }
4198        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i; i++) {
4199            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
4200                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4201            }
4202            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
4203        }
4204        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0)
4205            ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation));
4206        return ssb.toString();
4207    }

4247     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces

4257    /**
4258     * Generate a sentence from this FakeLanguageGen using the given RNG that fits in the given length limit. The
4259     * sentence's length in words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive, unless it would exceed
4260     * maxChars, in which case it is truncated. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from {@code midPunctuation}
4261     * between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency} (between 0 and 1), and
4262     * will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
4263     *
4264     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
4265     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
4266     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
4267     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
4268     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
4269     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4270     *                                the very end of a sentence
4271     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4272     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4273     * @param maxChars                the longest string length this can produce; should be at least {@code 6 * minWords}
4274     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4275     */
4276    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4277                           double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars) {
4278        if(maxChars < 0)
4279            return sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midPunctuationFrequency);
4280        if (minWords < 1)
4281            minWords = 1;
4282        if (minWords > maxWords)
4283            maxWords = minWords;
4284        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4285            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4286        }
4287        if (maxChars < 4)
4288            return "!";
4289        if (maxChars <= 5 * minWords) {
4290            minWords = 1;
4291            maxWords = 1;
4292        }
4293        int frustration = 0;
4294        ssb.setLength(0); 
4295        ssb.ensureCapacity(maxChars);
4296        String next = word(rng, true);
4297        while (next.length() >= maxChars - 1 && frustration < 50) {
4298            next = word(rng, true);
4299            frustration++;
4300        }
4301        if (frustration >= 50) return "!";
4302        ssb.append(next);
4303        for (int i = 1; i < minWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7; i++) {
4304            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4305                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4306            }
4307            next = word(rng, false);
4308            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4309                next = word(rng, false);
4310                frustration++;
4311            }
4312            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4313            ssb.append(' ').append(next);
4314        }
4315        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7 && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i && frustration < 50; i++) {
4316            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4317                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4318            }
4319            next = word(rng, false);
4320            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4321                next = word(rng, false);
4322                frustration++;
4323            }
4324            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4325            ssb.append(' ');
4326            ssb.append(next);
4327        }
4328
4329        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0) {
4330
4331            next = rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation);
4332            if (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars)
4333                ssb.append('.');
4334            else
4335                ssb.append(next);
4336        }
4337
4338        if (ssb.length() > maxChars)
4339            return "!";
4340        return ssb.toString();
4341    }
4342
4343    protected String[] merge1000(IRNG rng, String[] me, String[] other, double otherInfluence) {
4344        if (other.length <= 0 && me.length <= 0)
4345            return new String[]{};
4346        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4347        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * otherInfluence);
4348        int idx = 0;
4349        if (other.length > 0) {
4350            String[] tmp = new String[other.length];
4351            rng.shuffle(other, tmp);
4352            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4353                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4354            }
4355        }
4356        if (me.length > 0) {
4357            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4358            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4359            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4360                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4361            }
4362        } else {
4363            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4364                ret[idx] = other[idx % other.length];
4365            }
4366        }
4367        return ret;
4368    }

4371    protected String[] accentVowels(IRNG rng, String[] me, double influence) {
4372        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4373        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * influence);
4374        int idx = 0;
4375        Matcher matcher;
4376        if (me.length > 0) {
4377            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4378            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4379            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4380                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length]
4381                        .replace('a', accentedVowels[0][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[0].length)])
4382                        .replace('e', accentedVowels[1][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[1].length)])
4383                        .replace('i', accentedVowels[2][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[2].length)])
4384                        .replace('o', accentedVowels[3][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[3].length)])
4385                        .replace('u', accentedVowels[4][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[4].length)]);
4386                matcher = repeats.matcher(ret[idx]);
4387                if (matcher.find()) {
4388                    ret[idx] = matcher.replaceAll(rng.getRandomElement(me));
4389                }
4390            }
4391            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4392                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4393            }
4394        } else
4395            return new String[]{};
4396        return ret;
4397    }

4535    /**
4536     * Makes a new FakeLanguageGen that mixes this object with {@code other}, mingling the consonants and vowels they
4537     * use as well as any word suffixes or other traits, and favoring the qualities in {@code other} by
4538     * {@code otherInfluence}, which will value both languages evenly if it is 0.5 . 
4539     * @param other another FakeLanguageGen to mix along with this one into a new language
4540     * @param otherInfluence how much other should affect the pair, with 0.5 being equal and 1.0 being only other used
4541     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with traits from both languages
4542     */
4543    public FakeLanguageGen mix(FakeLanguageGen other, double otherInfluence) {
4544        otherInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(otherInfluence, 1.0));
4545        double myInfluence = 1.0 - otherInfluence;
4546
4547        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(), other.hashCode() ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(otherInfluence));
4548
4549        String[] ov = merge1000(rng, openingVowels, other.openingVowels, otherInfluence),
4550                mv = merge1000(rng, midVowels, other.midVowels, otherInfluence),
4551                oc = merge1000(rng, openingConsonants, other.openingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4552                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelStartFrequency + vowelStartFrequency))),
4553                mc = merge1000(rng, midConsonants, other.midConsonants, otherInfluence),
4554                cc = merge1000(rng, closingConsonants, other.closingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4555                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelEndFrequency + vowelEndFrequency))),
4556                cs = merge1000(rng, closingSyllables, other.closingSyllables, otherInfluence *
4557                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, other.syllableEndFrequency - syllableEndFrequency))),
4558                splitters = merge1000(rng, vowelSplitters, other.vowelSplitters, otherInfluence);
4559
4560        double[] fr = new double[Math.max(syllableFrequencies.length, other.syllableFrequencies.length)];
4561        System.arraycopy(syllableFrequencies, 0, fr, 0, syllableFrequencies.length);
4562        for (int i = 0; i < other.syllableFrequencies.length; i++) {
4563            fr[i] += other.syllableFrequencies[i];
4564        }
4565        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(modifiers.size() + other.modifiers.size());
4566        mods.addAll(modifiers);
4567        mods.addAll(other.modifiers);
4568        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, splitters, fr,
4569                vowelStartFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelStartFrequency * otherInfluence,
4570                vowelEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4571                vowelSplitFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelSplitFrequency * otherInfluence,
4572                syllableEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.syllableEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4573                (sanityChecks == null) ? other.sanityChecks : sanityChecks, true, mods)
4574                .setName(otherInfluence > 0.5 ? other.name + "/" + name : name + "/" + other.name);
4575    }
4576
4577    private static double readDouble(Object o) {
4578        if (o instanceof Double) return (Double) o;
4579        else if (o instanceof Float) return (Float) o;
4580        else if (o instanceof Long) return ((Long) o).doubleValue();
4581        else if (o instanceof Integer) return (Integer) o;
4582        else if (o instanceof Short) return (Short) o;
4583        else if (o instanceof Byte) return (Byte) o;
4584        else if (o instanceof Character) return (Character) o;
4585        return 0.0;
4586    }
4587
4588    /**
4589     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen by mixing this FakeLanguageGen with one or more other FakeLanguageGen objects. Takes
4590     * a weight for this, another FakeLanguageGen, a weight for that FakeLanguageGen, then a possibly-empty group of
4591     * FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters. If other1 is null or if pairs has been given a
4592     * value of null instead of the normal (possibly empty) array of Objects, then this simply returns a copy of this
4593     * FakeLanguageGen. Otherwise, it will at least mix this language with other1 using the given weights for each.
4594     * If pairs is not empty, it has special requirements for what types it allows and in what order, but does no type
4595     * checking. Specifically, pairs requires the first Object to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some
4596     * kind that will be the weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and
4597     * converts them to Double if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern
4598     * (FakeLanguageGen, then number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4599     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4600     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4601     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4602     * with 0.33 .
4603     * <br>
4604     * Unlike the static method {@link #mixAll(Object...)}, this _is_ intended for external use, in part because the
4605     * technique for mixing languages by weight is so much more intuitive, but also because this assigns valid data for
4606     * serializing and deserializing this FakeLanguageGen that allows it to use significantly less space (less than 1/72
4607     * the bytes used in one not-quite-simple test).
4608     *
4609     * @param myWeight the weight to assign this FakeLanguageGen in the mix
4610     * @param other1   another FakeLanguageGen to mix in; if null, this method will abort and return {@link #copy()}
4611     * @param weight1  the weight to assign other1 in the mix
4612     * @param pairs    may be empty, not null; otherwise must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4613     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing this with any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4614     */
4615    public FakeLanguageGen mix(double myWeight, FakeLanguageGen other1, double weight1, Object... pairs) {
4616        if (other1 == null || pairs == null)
4617            return copy();
4618        OrderedSet<Modifier> mods = new OrderedSet<>(modifiers);
4619        FakeLanguageGen mixer = removeModifiers();
4620        FakeLanguageGen[] languages = new FakeLanguageGen[2 + (pairs.length >>> 1)];
4621        double[] weights = new double[languages.length];
4622        String[] summaries = new String[languages.length];
4623        boolean summarize = true;
4624        double total = 0.0, current, weight;
4625        languages[0] = mixer;
4626        total += weights[0] = myWeight;
4627        if ((summaries[0] = mixer.summary) == null) summarize = false;
4628        mods.addAll(other1.modifiers);
4629        languages[1] = other1.removeModifiers();
4630        total += weights[1] = weight1;
4631        if (summarize && (summaries[1] = languages[1].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4632        for (int i = 1, p = 2; i < pairs.length; i += 2, p++) {
4633            if (pairs[i] == null || pairs[i - 1] == null)
4634                continue;
4635            languages[p] = ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[i - 1]).removeModifiers();
4636            total += weights[p] = readDouble(pairs[i]);
4637            if (summarize && (summaries[p] = languages[p].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4638        }
4639        if (total == 0)
4640            return copy();
4641        current = myWeight / total;
4642        for (int i = 1; i < languages.length; i++) {
4643            if ((weight = weights[i]) > 0)
4644                mixer = mixer.mix(languages[i], weight / total / (current += weight / total));
4645        }
4646        if (summarize) {
4647            sb.setLength(0);
4648            String c;
4649            int idx;
4650            for (int i = 0; i < summaries.length; i++) {
4651                c = summaries[i];
4652                idx = c.indexOf('@');
4653                if (idx >= 0) {
4654                    sb.append(c, 0, idx + 1).append(weights[i]);
4655                    if (i < summaries.length - 1)
4656                        sb.append('~');
4657                }
4658            }
4659            for (int i = 0; i < mods.size(); i++) {
4660                sb.append('℗').append(mods.getAt(i).serializeToString());
4661            }
4662            return mixer.addModifiers(mods).summarize(sb.toString());
4663        } else
4664            return mixer.addModifiers(mods);
4665    }
4666
4667    /**
4668     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen from a group of FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters.
4669     * Requires the first Object in pairs to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some kind that will be the
4670     * weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and converts them to Double
4671     * if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern (FakeLanguageGen, then
4672     * number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). There should be at least 4 elements in pairs, half of them
4673     * languages and half of them weights, for this to do any mixing, but it can produce a result with as little as one
4674     * FakeLanguageGen (returning a copy of the first FakeLanguageGen). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4675     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4676     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4677     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4678     * with 0.33 .
4679     * <br>
4680     * Not intended for external use, but it could be useful. Used internally in the deserialization code.
4681     *
4682     * @param pairs should have at least one item, and must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4683     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4684     */
4685    public static FakeLanguageGen mixAll(Object... pairs) {
4686        int len;
4687        if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 0)
4688            return ENGLISH.copy();
4689        if (len < 4)
4690            return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).copy();
4691        Object[] pairs2 = new Object[len - 4];
4692        if (len > 4)
4693            System.arraycopy(pairs, 4, pairs2, 0, len - 4);
4694        return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).mix(readDouble(pairs[1]), (FakeLanguageGen) pairs[2], readDouble(pairs[3]), pairs2);
4695    }
4696
4697    /**
4698     * Produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with extra vowels and/or consonants possible, adding from a wide
4699     * selection of accented vowels (if vowelInfluence is above 0.0) and/or consonants (if consonantInfluence is above
4700     * 0.0). This may produce a gibberish-looking language with no rhyme or reason to the accents, and generally
4701     * consonantInfluence should be very low if it is above 0 at all.
4702     * @param vowelInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect vowels at all
4703     * @param consonantInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect consonants at all
4704     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with modifications to add accented vowels and/or consonants
4705     */
4706    public FakeLanguageGen addAccents(double vowelInfluence, double consonantInfluence) {
4707        vowelInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(vowelInfluence, 1.0));
4708        consonantInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(consonantInfluence, 1.0));
4709        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(),
4710                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelInfluence)
4711                        ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(consonantInfluence));
4712        String[] ov = accentVowels(rng, openingVowels, vowelInfluence),
4713                mv = accentVowels(rng, midVowels, vowelInfluence),
4714                oc = accentConsonants(rng, openingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4715                mc = accentConsonants(rng, midConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4716                cc = accentConsonants(rng, closingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4717                cs = accentBoth(rng, closingSyllables, vowelInfluence, consonantInfluence);
4718
4719
4720        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4721                vowelStartFrequency,
4722                vowelEndFrequency,
4723                vowelSplitFrequency,
4724                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers).setName(name + "-Bònüs");
4725    }
4726
4727    private static String[] copyStrings(String[] start) {
4728        String[] next = new String[start.length];
4729        System.arraycopy(start, 0, next, 0, start.length);
4730        return next;
4731    }

4733    /**
4734     * Useful for cases with limited fonts, this produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with all accented
4735     * characters removed (including almost all non-ASCII Latin-alphabet characters, but only some Greek and Cyrillic
4736     * characters). This will replace letters like "A with a ring" with just "A". Some of the letters chosen as
4737     * replacements aren't exact matches.
4738     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but without accented letters
4739     */
4740    public FakeLanguageGen removeAccents() {
4741
4742        String[] ov = copyStrings(openingVowels),
4743                mv = copyStrings(midVowels),
4744                oc = copyStrings(openingConsonants),
4745                mc = copyStrings(midConsonants),
4746                cc = copyStrings(closingConsonants),
4747                cs = copyStrings(closingSyllables);
4748        for (int i = 0; i < ov.length; i++) {
4749            ov[i] = removeAccents(openingVowels[i]).toString();
4750        }
4751        for (int i = 0; i < mv.length; i++) {
4752            mv[i] = removeAccents(midVowels[i]).toString();
4753        }
4754        for (int i = 0; i < oc.length; i++) {
4755            oc[i] = removeAccents(openingConsonants[i]).toString();
4756        }
4757        for (int i = 0; i < mc.length; i++) {
4758            mc[i] = removeAccents(midConsonants[i]).toString();
4759        }
4760        for (int i = 0; i < cc.length; i++) {
4761            cc[i] = removeAccents(closingConsonants[i]).toString();
4762        }
4763        for (int i = 0; i < cs.length; i++) {
4764            cs[i] = removeAccents(closingSyllables[i]).toString();
4765        }
4766
4767        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4768                vowelStartFrequency,
4769                vowelEndFrequency,
4770                vowelSplitFrequency,
4771                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers);
4772    }

4774    /**
4775     * Returns the name of this FakeLanguageGen, such as "English" or "Deep Speech", if one was registered for this.
4776     * In the case of hybrid languages produced by {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} or related methods, this should
4777     * produce a String like "English/French" (or "English/French/Maori" if more are mixed together). If no name was
4778     * registered, this will return "Nameless Language".
4779     * @return the human-readable name of this language, or "Nameless Language" if none is known
4780     */
4781    public String getName() {
4782        return name;
4783    }

4787        return this;

4849    @Override
4850    public boolean equals(Object o) {
4851        if (this == o) return true;
4852        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
4853
4854        FakeLanguageGen that = (FakeLanguageGen) o;
4855
4856        if (clean != that.clean) return false;
4857        if (Double.compare(that.totalSyllableFrequency, totalSyllableFrequency) != 0) return false;
4858        if (Double.compare(that.vowelStartFrequency, vowelStartFrequency) != 0) return false;
4859        if (Double.compare(that.vowelEndFrequency, vowelEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4860        if (Double.compare(that.vowelSplitFrequency, vowelSplitFrequency) != 0) return false;
4861        if (Double.compare(that.syllableEndFrequency, syllableEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4862        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4863        if (!Arrays.equals(openingVowels, that.openingVowels)) return false;
4864        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4865        if (!Arrays.equals(midVowels, that.midVowels)) return false;
4866        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4867        if (!Arrays.equals(openingConsonants, that.openingConsonants)) return false;
4868        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4869        if (!Arrays.equals(midConsonants, that.midConsonants)) return false;
4870        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4871        if (!Arrays.equals(closingConsonants, that.closingConsonants)) return false;
4872        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4873        if (!Arrays.equals(vowelSplitters, that.vowelSplitters)) return false;
4874        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4875        if (!Arrays.equals(closingSyllables, that.closingSyllables)) return false;
4876        if (!Arrays.equals(syllableFrequencies, that.syllableFrequencies)) return false;
4877        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4878        if (!Arrays.equals(sanityChecks, that.sanityChecks)) return false;
4879        return modifiers != null ? modifiers.equals(that.modifiers) : that.modifiers == null;
4880    }
4881
4882    @Override
4883    public int hashCode() {
4884        int result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 +
4885                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(openingVowels) +
4886                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(midVowels) +
4887                31 * CrossHash.hash(openingConsonants) +
4888                CrossHash.hash(midConsonants) | 0;
4889        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4890                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(closingConsonants) +
4891                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(vowelSplitters) +
4892                31 * CrossHash.hash(closingSyllables) ^
4893                (clean ? 1 : 0);
4894        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4895                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(syllableFrequencies) +
4896                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(totalSyllableFrequency) +
4897                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelStartFrequency) +
4898                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelEndFrequency) | 0;
4899        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4900                31 * 31 * 31 * (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1 : 0) +
4901                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(syllableEndFrequency) +                 
4902                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelSplitFrequency) | 0;
4903        if(modifiers != null) {
4904            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4905                result = result + 7 * (i + 1) * modifiers.get(i).hashCode() | 0;
4906            }
4907        }
4908        return result;
4909    }
4910    public long hash64() {
4911        long result           = CrossHash.hash64(openingVowels);
4912        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midVowels);
4913        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(openingConsonants);
4914        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midConsonants);
4915        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingConsonants);
4916        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(vowelSplitters);
4917        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingSyllables);
4918        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(syllableFrequencies);
4919        result = 31L * result + (clean ? 1L : 0L);
4920        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(totalSyllableFrequency);
4921        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelStartFrequency);
4922        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelEndFrequency);
4923        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelSplitFrequency);
4924        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(syllableEndFrequency);
4925        result = 31L * result + (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1L : 0L);
4926        result *= 31L;
4927        if(modifiers != null) {
4928            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4929                result += 7L * (i + 1L) * CrossHash.hash64(modifiers.get(i).alterations);
4930            }
4931        }
4932        return result;
4933    }

4968
4969    public static FakeLanguageGen deserializeFromString(String data) {
4970        if (data == null || data.equals(""))
4971            return ENGLISH.copy();
4972        int poundIndex = data.indexOf('#'), snailIndex = data.indexOf('@'), tempBreak = data.indexOf('℗'),
4973                breakIndex = (tempBreak < 0) ? data.length() : tempBreak,
4974                tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~'), breakIndex), prevTildeIndex = -1;
4975        if (tildeIndex < 0)
4976            tildeIndex = data.length();
4977
4978        if (snailIndex < 0)
4979            return ENGLISH.copy();
4980        ArrayList<Object> pairs = new ArrayList<>(4);
4981        while (snailIndex >= 0) {
4982            if (poundIndex >= 0 && poundIndex < snailIndex) // random case
4983            {
4984                pairs.add(randomLanguage(Long.parseLong(data.substring(poundIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
4985                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
4986                poundIndex = -1;
4987            } else {
4988                pairs.add(registry.getAt(Integer.parseInt(data.substring(prevTildeIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
4989                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
4990            }
4991            snailIndex = data.indexOf('@', snailIndex + 1);
4992            if (snailIndex > breakIndex)
4993                break;
4994            prevTildeIndex = tildeIndex;
4995            tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~', tildeIndex + 1), breakIndex);
4996            if (tildeIndex < 0)
4997                tildeIndex = data.length();
4998        }
4999        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(8);
5000        if (breakIndex == tempBreak) {
5001            tildeIndex = breakIndex - 1;
5002            while ((prevTildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', tildeIndex + 1)) >= 0) {
5003                tildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', prevTildeIndex + 1);
5004                if (tildeIndex < 0) tildeIndex = data.length();
5005                mods.add(Modifier.deserializeFromString(data.substring(prevTildeIndex, tildeIndex)));
5006            }
5007        }
5008        FakeLanguageGen flg = mixAll(pairs.toArray());
5009        flg.modifiers.addAll(mods);
5010        return flg;
5011    }
5012
5013    public static class Modifier implements Serializable {
5014        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1734863678490422371L;
5015        private transient static final StringBuilder modSB = new StringBuilder(32);
5016        public final Alteration[] alterations;
5017
5018        public Modifier() {
5019            alterations = new Alteration[0];
5020        }
5021
5022        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement) {
5023            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement)};
5024        }
5025
5026        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5027            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement, chance)};
5028        }
5029
5030        public Modifier(Alteration... alts) {
5031            alterations = (alts == null) ? new Alteration[0] : alts;
5032        }
5033
5034        public StringBuilder modify(IRNG rng, StringBuilder sb) {
5035            Matcher m;
5036            Replacer.StringBuilderBuffer tb;
5037            boolean found;
5038            Alteration alt;
5039            for (int a = 0; a < alterations.length; a++) {
5040                alt = alterations[a];
5041                modSB.setLength(0);
5042                tb = Replacer.wrap(modSB);
5043                m = alt.replacer.getPattern().matcher(sb);
5044
5045                found = false;
5046                while (true) {
5047                    if (alt.chance >= 1 || rng.nextDouble() < alt.chance) {
5048                        if (!Replacer.replaceStep(m, alt.replacer.getSubstitution(), tb))
5049                            break;
5050                        found = true;
5051                    } else {
5052                        if (!m.find())
5053                            break;
5054                        found = true;
5055                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.PREFIX, tb);
5056                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.MATCH, tb);
5057                        m.setTarget(m, MatchResult.SUFFIX);
5058                    }
5059                }
5060                if (found) {
5061                    m.getGroup(MatchResult.TARGET, tb);
5062                    sb.setLength(0);
5063                    sb.append(modSB);
5064                }
5065            }
5066            return sb;
5067        }

5084                new Alteration("^([aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу]+)", "$1-$1", 0.2));

5108        /**
5109         * Removes accented letters and the two non-English consonants from text generated with {@link #NORSE}.
5110         * Replaces á, é, í, ý, ó, æ, ú, and ö with a, e, i, y, o, ae, and ou. In some instances, replaces j
5111         * with y. Replaces ð and þ with th and th, except for when preceded by s (then it replaces sð or sþ
5112         * with st or st) or when the start of a word is fð or fþ, where it replaces with fr or fr.
5113         */
5114        public static final Modifier SIMPLIFY_NORSE = replacementTable(
5115                "á", "a",
5116                "é", "e",
5117                "í", "i",
5118                "ý", "y",
5119                "ó", "o",
5120                "ú", "u",
5121                "æ", "ae",
5122                "ö", "ou",
5123                "([^aeiou])jy", "$1yai",
5124                "([^aeiou])j(?:[aeiouy]+)", "$1yo",
5125                "s([ðþ])", "st",
5126                "\\bf[ðþ]", "fr",
5127                "[ðþ]", "th");

5129        /**
5130         * Simple changes to merge "ae" into "æ", "oe" into "œ", and any of "aé", "áe", or "áé" into "ǽ".
5131         */
5132        public static final Modifier LIGATURES = replacementTable("ae", "æ", "oe", "œ", "áe", "ǽ", "aé", "ǽ", "áé", "ǽ");
5133        /**
5134         * Some changes that can be applied when sanity checks (which force re-generating a new word) aren't appropriate
5135         * for fixing a word that isn't pronounceable.
5136         */
5137        public static final Modifier GENERAL_CLEANUP = replacementTable(
5138                "[æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœýÿŷỳy])", "$1",
5139                "q([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])$", "q$1e",
5140                "([ìíîïĩīĭįıi])[ìíîïĩīĭįıi]", "$1",
5141                "([æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy])[wŵẁẃẅ]$", "$1",
5142                "([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])([òóôõöøōŏőǿo])", "$2$1",
5143                "[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœ])", "$1",
5144                "([æǽœ])[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]", "$1",
5145                "([wŵẁẃẅ])[wŵẁẃẅ]", "$1",
5146                "qq", "q");

5148        //àáâãäåāăąǻæǽaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőœǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy
5149        //bcçćĉċčdþðďđfgĝğġģhĥħjĵȷkķlĺļľŀłmnñńņňŋpqrŕŗřsśŝşšștţťțvwŵẁẃẅxyýÿŷỳzźżž

5151        /**
5152         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth char in initial with the nth char in change. Expects initial and
5153         * change to be the same length, but will use the lesser length if they are not equal-length. Because of the
5154         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5155         *
5156         * @param initial a String containing lower-case letters or other symbols to be swapped out of a text
5157         * @param change  a String containing characters that will replace occurrences of characters in initial
5158         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5159         */
5160        public static Modifier charReplacementTable(String initial, String change) {
5161            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[Math.min(initial.length(), change.length())];
5162            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5163                //literal string syntax; avoids sensitive escaping issues and also doesn't need a character class,
5164                // which is slightly slower and has some odd escaping cases.
5165                alts[i] = new Alteration("\\Q" + initial.charAt(i), change.substring(i, i + 1));
5166            }
5167            return new Modifier(alts);
5168        }
5169
5170        /**
5171         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth String key in map with the nth value. Because of the
5172         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5173         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex pattern strings as keys and replacement syntax,
5174         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5175         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5176         * The ordering of map matters if a later key contains an earlier key (the earlier one will be replaced
5177         * first, possibly making the later key not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5178         * become valid.
5179         *
5180         * @param map containing String keys to replace and String values to use instead; replacements happen in order
5181         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5182         */
5183        public static Modifier replacementTable(OrderedMap<String, String> map) {
5184            if (map == null)
5185                return new Modifier();
5186            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[map.size()];
5187            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5188                alts[i] = new Alteration(map.keyAt(i), map.getAt(i));
5189            }
5190            return new Modifier(alts);
5191        }
5192
5193        /**
5194         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the (n*2)th String in pairs with the (n*2+1)th value in pairs. Because
5195         * of the state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5196         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex syntax for search and replacement Strings,
5197         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5198         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5199         * The ordering of pairs matters if a later search contains an earlier search (the earlier one will be replaced
5200         * first, possibly making the later search not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5201         * become valid.
5202         *
5203         * @param pairs array or vararg of alternating Strings to search for and Strings to replace with; replacements happen in order
5204         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5205         */
5206        public static Modifier replacementTable(String... pairs) {
5207            int len;
5208            if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 1)
5209                return new Modifier();
5210            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[len >> 1];
5211            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5212                alts[i] = new Alteration(pairs[i<< 1], pairs[i<<1|1]);
5213            }
5214            return new Modifier(alts);
5215        }
5216
5217        /**
5218         * Adds the potential for the String {@code insertion} to be used as a vowel in addition to the vowels that the
5219         * language already uses; insertion will replace an existing vowel (at any point in a word that had a vowel
5220         * generated) with a probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.1 at most) unless you want the
5221         * newly-inserted vowel to be likely to be present in every word of some sentences.
5222         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional vowel
5223         * @param chance the chance for a vowel cluster to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.1 or less
5224         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5225         */
5226        public static Modifier insertVowel(String insertion, double chance)
5227        {
5228            return new Modifier(anyVowelCluster, insertion, chance);
5229        }
5230

5232         * Adds the potential for the String {@code insertion} to be used as a consonant in addition to the consonants
5233         * that the language already uses; insertion will replace an existing consonant (at any point in a word that had
5234         * a consonant generated) with a probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.1 at most) unless you
5235         * want the newly-inserted consonant to be likely to be present in every word of some sentences.
5236         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional consonant
5237         * @param chance the chance for a consonant cluster to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.1 or less
5238         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5239         */
5240        public static Modifier insertConsonant(String insertion, double chance)
5241        {
5242            return new Modifier(anyConsonantCluster, insertion, chance);
5243        }

5245        /**
5246         * Adds the potential for the String {@code insertion} to be used as a vowel in addition to the vowels that the
5247         * language already uses; insertion will replace an existing vowel at the start of a word with a probability of
5248         * {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.2 at most) unless you want the newly-inserted vowel to be likely
5249         * to start every word of some sentences. Not all languages can start words with vowels, or do that very rarely,
5250         * so this might not do anything.
5251         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional opening vowel
5252         * @param chance the chance for a vowel cluster at the start of a word to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.2 or less
5253         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5254         */
5255        public static Modifier insertOpeningVowel(String insertion, double chance)
5256        {
5257            return new Modifier("\\b[àáâãäåæāăąǻǽaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőœǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳyαοειυωаеёийоуъыэюя]+", insertion, chance);
5258        }

5260        /**

5262         * that the language already uses; insertion will replace an existing consonant at the start of a word with a
5263         * probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.2 at most) unless you want the newly-inserted
5264         * consonant to be likely to start every word of some sentences. Not all languages can start words with
5265         * consonants, or do that very rarely, so this might not do anything.
5266         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional opening consonant
5267         * @param chance the chance for a consonant cluster at the start of a word to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.2 or less
5268         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5269         */
5270        public static Modifier insertOpeningConsonant(String insertion, double chance)
5271        {
5272            return new Modifier("\\b[bcçćĉċčdþðďđfgĝğġģhĥħjĵȷkķlĺļľŀłmnñńņňŋpqrŕŗřsśŝşšștţťțvwŵẁẃẅxyýÿŷỳzźżžρσζτκχνθμπψβλγφξςбвгдклпрстфхцжмнзчшщ]+", insertion, chance);
5273        }

5288        }

5300        public static Modifier insertClosingConsonant(String insertion, double chance)

5355        @Override
5356        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5357            if (this == o) return true;
5358            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5359
5360            Modifier modifier = (Modifier) o;
5361
5362            // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
5363            return Arrays.equals(alterations, modifier.alterations);
5364        }
5365
5366        @Override
5367        public int hashCode() {
5368            return CrossHash.hash(alterations);
5369        }
5370
5371        @Override
5372        public String toString() {
5373            return "Modifier{" +
5374                    "alterations=" + Arrays.toString(alterations) +
5375                    '}';
5376        }
5377
5378        public String serializeToString() {
5379            if (alterations.length == 0) return "\6";
5380            modSB.setLength(0);
5381            modSB.append('\6');
5382            for (int i = 0; i < alterations.length; i++)
5383                modSB.append(alterations[i].serializeToString()).append('\6');
5384            return modSB.toString();
5385        }
5386
5387        public static Modifier deserializeFromString(String data) {
5388            int currIdx = data.indexOf(6), altIdx = currIdx, matches = 0;
5389            while (currIdx >= 0) {
5390                if ((currIdx = data.indexOf(6, currIdx + 1)) < 0)
5391                    break;
5392                matches++;
5393            }
5394            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[matches];
5395            for (int i = 0; i < matches; i++) {
5396                alts[i] = Alteration.deserializeFromString(data.substring(altIdx + 1, altIdx = data.indexOf(6, altIdx + 1)));
5397            }
5398            return new Modifier(alts);
5399        }
5400    }
5401
5402    public static class Alteration implements Serializable {
5403        private static final long serialVersionUID = -2138854697837563188L;
5404        public Replacer replacer;
5405        public String replacement;
5406        public double chance;
5407
5408        public Alteration() {
5409            this("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");
5410        }
5411
5412        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement) {
5413            this.replacement = replacement;
5414            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5415            chance = 1.0;
5416        }
5417
5418        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5419            this.replacement = replacement;
5420            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5421            this.chance = chance;
5422        }
5423
5424        public Alteration(Pattern pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5425            this.replacement = replacement;
5426            replacer = pattern.replacer(replacement);
5427            this.chance = chance;
5428        }
5429
5430        @Override
5431        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5432            if (this == o) return true;
5433            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5434
5435            Alteration that = (Alteration) o;
5436
5437            if (Double.compare(that.chance, chance) != 0) return false;
5438            return replacer.equals(that.replacer);
5439
5440        }
5441
5442        @Override
5443        public int hashCode() {
5444            long result;
5445            result = CrossHash.hash64(replacer.getPattern().serializeToString());
5446            result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(chance);
5447            result ^= result >>> 32;
5448            return (int) (0xFFFFFFFFL & result);
5449        }
5450
5451        @Override
5452        public String toString() {
5453            return "Alteration{" +
5454                    "replacer=" + replacer +
5455                    ", chance=" + chance +
5456                    '}';
5457        }
5458
5459        public String serializeToString() {
5460            return replacer.getPattern().serializeToString() + '\2' + replacement + '\4' + chance;
5461        }
5462
5463        public static Alteration deserializeFromString(String data) {
5464            int split2 = data.indexOf('\2'), split4 = data.indexOf('\4');
5465            return new Alteration(Pattern.deserializeFromString(data.substring(0, split2)),
5466                    data.substring(split2 + 1, split4),
5467                    Double.parseDouble(data.substring(split4 + 1)));
5468        }
5469    }
5470
5471    /**
5472     * A simple way to bundle a FakeLanguageGen with the arguments that would be passed to it when calling
5473     * {@link FakeLanguageGen#sentence(IRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} or one of its overloads.
5474     * You can call {@link #sentence()} on this to produce another String sentence with the parameters it was given
5475     * at construction. The parameters to
5476     * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, IStatefulRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} are stored in fields of
5477     * the same name, and all fields in this class are public and modifiable.
5478     */
5479    public static class SentenceForm implements Serializable
5480    {
5481        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1246527948419533147L;
5482        public IStatefulRNG rng;
5483        public int minWords, maxWords, maxChars;
5484        public String[] midPunctuation, endPunctuation;
5485        public double midPunctuationFrequency;
5486        public FakeLanguageGen language;
5487
5488        /**
5489         * Builds a SentenceForm with all default fields, using {@link FakeLanguageGen#FANTASY_NAME} for a language,
5490         * using between 1 and 9 words in a sentence, and otherwise defaulting to how
5491         * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, int, int)} behaves.
5492         */
5493        public SentenceForm()
5494        {
5495            this(FakeLanguageGen.FANTASY_NAME, FakeLanguageGen.srng, 1, 9,
5496                    mid,
5497                    end, 0.18, -1);
5498        }
5499        /**
5500         * Builds a SentenceForm with only a few fields specified. The {@link #rng} will be made based on
5501         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, maxChars will be -1 so the sentence length
5502         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced, and the between-word and end-of-sentence
5503         * punctuation will be set to reasonable defaults. This places either a comma or a semicolon after a word in the
5504         * middle of a sentence about 18% of the time ({@code midPunctuationFrequency} is 0.18), and can end a sentence
5505         * in a period, exclamation mark, question mark, or ellipsis (the "..." punctuation).
5506         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5507         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5508         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5509         */
5510        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords)
5511        {
5512            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, mid,
5513                    end, 0.18, -1);
5514        }
5515        /**
5516         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5517         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, and maxChars, which means the sentence length
5518         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced.
5519         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5520         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5521         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5522         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5523         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5524         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5525         */
5526        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5527                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency)
5528        {
5529            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5530                    midPunctuationFrequency, -1);
5531        }
5532        /**
5533         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5534         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field.
5535         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5536         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5537         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5538         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5539         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5540         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5541         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5542         */
5543        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5544                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5545        {
5546            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5547                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5548        }
5549
5550        /**
5551         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified; each value is referenced directly except for {@code rng},
5552         * which will not change or be directly referenced (a new GWTRNG will be used with the same state value).
5553         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5554         * @param rng a StatefulRNG that will not be directly referenced; the state will be copied into a new StatefulRNG
5555         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5556         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5557         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5558         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5559         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5560         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5561         */
5562        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, IStatefulRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords,
5563                            String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
5564                            double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5565        {
5566            this.language = language;
5567            this.rng = new GWTRNG(rng.getState());
5568            this.minWords = minWords;
5569            this.maxWords = maxWords;
5570            this.midPunctuation = midPunctuation;
5571            this.endPunctuation = endPunctuation;
5572            this.midPunctuationFrequency = midPunctuationFrequency;
5573            this.maxChars = maxChars;
5574        }
5575        public String sentence()
5576        {
5577            return language.sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5578                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5579        }
5580
5581        public String serializeToString() {
5582            return language.serializeToString() + '℘' +
5583                    rng.getState() + '℘' +
5584                    minWords + '℘' +
5585                    maxWords + '℘' +
5586                    StringKit.join("ℙ", midPunctuation) + '℘' +
5587                    StringKit.join("ℙ", endPunctuation) + '℘' +
5588                    NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(midPunctuationFrequency) + '℘' +
5589                    maxChars;
5590        }
5591        public static SentenceForm deserializeFromString(String ser)
5592        {
5593            int gap = ser.indexOf('℘');
5594            FakeLanguageGen lang = FakeLanguageGen.deserializeFromString(ser.substring(0, gap));
5595            GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(
5596                    StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5597            int minWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5598            int maxWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5599            String[] midPunctuation =
5600                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5601            String[] endPunctuation =
5602                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5603            double midFreq = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5604            int maxChars = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, ser.length());
5605            return new SentenceForm(lang, rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midFreq, maxChars);
5606        }
5607    }
5608}
